explanation: Angles are formed when two lines or rays meet. There are different types of angles. An acute angle is small. It is less than 90 degrees. A right angle is 90 degrees. It looks like the corner of a piece of paper. An obtuse angle is big. It is more than 90 degrees, but less than 180 degrees. A straight angle is 180 degrees. It looks like a straight line. Imagine you are standing with your arms straight out to the sides. Your arms and body make a straight angle. Let's review what we learned: we have acute, right, obtuse, and straight angles. Remembering these types of angles will help you solve problems and understand more about shapes and lines.

mcqs.question: What type of angle is less than 90 degrees?
What type of angle is 90 degrees?
What type of angle is more than 90 degrees, but less than 180 degrees?
What type of angle is 180 degrees?
